param.note: The controller the controlls the order Default: Actual controllerId

note.title: A list of workflow folders that contains the orders
note.p: Items sepearated by semicolon. When ending with /* the folder will be searched recursivly. Example: /folder/sub1;/another_folder/sub2/*

note.title: A list of search patterns for workflow folders that contains the orders
A list of search patterns for order names. May contain a folder. Items sepearated by semicolon..
note.p: May contain a folder. Items sepearated by semicolon. Example: *myWorkflow*, /folder/sub1/my?orkflow

note.title: The duration the order persists in the failed state.
note.p:
Available for FAILED orders. Example: 2d
an ISO 8601 date format with the time offset and milliseconds being optional, e.g. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.s][Z (Z means +00)] YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.s][+01:00] YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.s][+0100] YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.s][+01] a format for a period relative to the current time, e.g. 6h, 12h, 1d, 1w that specifies the quantity followed by a qualifier: s (seconds) m (minutes) h (hours) d (days) w (weeks) M (months) y (years) a time offset is optional (e.g. 2d+02:00) it can also be specified with the parameter timeZone if timeZone is undefined then UTC is used the value 0 indicates the current time

note.title: What is the purpose of this job?
note.p: The job find orders with the given state_transition_source in the specified folders and resumes them or cancel them.
